Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.

item.description: You can retrieve the original image. The URL is the same as in the [asset's](/developers/docs/references/content-delivery-api/#/reference/assets) `file.url` field.

item.name: Image format

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
The desired image output format.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
The desired image output format.

item.description:
You can convert the image to a different format.

Possible values:

- `jpg`

- `png`

- `webp`

- `gif`

- `avif`

The default is the original image format.

item.name: Progressive JPEGs

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.

item.description:
You can request a JPEG image as a *progressive* JPEG.

The progressive JPEG format stores multiple passes of an image in progressively higher detail.
While a progressive image is loading, the viewer first sees a lower quality pixelated version,
which gradually improves in detail, until the image is fully downloaded.
This displays the image as early as possible in order to maintain the layout as designed.

item.name: 8-bit PNGs

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.

item.description:
You can request a PNG image as a *8-bit* PNG.

8-bit PNG images support up to 256 colors and weight less than the standard 24-bit PNG equivalent.
The 8-bit PNG format is mostly used for simple images, such as icons or logos.

item.name: AVIF

request.description:
For images transformed into AVIF format, the image size limits as defined in [Technical Limits](/developers/docs/technical-limits/) apply.
Additionally, there is a 9 Megapixel limit on the size of the source image.
The limit applies to all service tiers (see [Technical Limits](/developers/docs/technical-limits/)).

originalRequest.description:
For images transformed into AVIF format, the image size limits as defined in [Technical Limits](/developers/docs/technical-limits/) apply.
Additionally, there is a 9 Megapixel limit on the size of the source image.
The limit applies to all service tiers (see [Technical Limits](/developers/docs/technical-limits/)).

item.description:
For images transformed into AVIF format, the image size limits as defined in [Technical Limits](/developers/docs/technical-limits/) apply.
Additionally, there is a 9 Megapixel limit on the size of the source image.
The limit applies to all service tiers (see [Technical Limits](/developers/docs/technical-limits/)).

item.name: Specify width & height

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which this image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
The desired width of the image in pixels (cannot be zero).
The desired height of the image in pixels (cannot be zero).
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which this image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
The desired width of the image in pixels (cannot be zero).
The desired height of the image in pixels (cannot be zero).

item.description:
You can resize the image to the desired width and height. The maximum allowed value is `4000` pixels.
The default is the original image width and height.

item.name: Change the resizing behavior

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
One of the types described above.
The desired width of the image in pixels.
The desired height of the image in pixels.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
One of the types described above.
The desired width of the image in pixels.
The desired height of the image in pixels.

item.description:
By default, images are resized to fit into the specified dimensions.
You can request a different behavior using the `fit` parameter.

Possible values:

- `pad`: Resize the image to the specified dimensions, padding the image if needed.

- `fill`: Resize the image to the specified dimensions, cropping the image if needed.

- `scale`: Resize the image to the specified dimensions, changing the original aspect ratio if needed.

- `crop`: Crop a part of the original image to fit into the specified dimensions.

- `thumb`: Create a thumbnail from the image.

`pad` behavior uses [background color](#/reference/image-manipulation/background-color) as padding color.

item.name: Specify focus area

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
One of the types described above.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
One of the types described above.

item.description:
You can choose the focus area for resizing when using fit type `pad`, `fill`, `crop` or `thumb`.
Focus area has no effect on the default or `scale` fit type.

Possible values:

- `center`, `top`, `right`, `left`, `bottom`.

- `top_right`, `top_left`, `bottom_right`, `bottom_left`.

- `face` for the largest face detected.

- `faces` for all the faces detected.

The default is `center`.

item.name: Crop rounded corners & circle/elipsis

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
A value as described above.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
A value as described above.

item.description:
You can add rounded corners to your image or crop to a circle/ellipse.

Possible values:

- The size of the corner radius in pixels.

- `max` keyword for a full circle/ellipse.

The default is `0`.

Rounded corners use [background color](#/reference/image-manipulation/background-color) as padding color,
unless the format is `jpg` and resizing behavior is `pad`, then default to white.

item.name: Quality

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which this image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
Quality as a percentage, between 1 and 100.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which this image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
Quality as a percentage, between 1 and 100.

item.description:
You can alter the quality of the image, expressed as a percentage value between `1` and `100`.
Quality value is only ignored for 8-bit PNGs.

item.name: Background color

variable.description: Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
A color constant as described above.
The desired width of the image.
The desired height of the image.
Alphanumeric id of the space to retrieve.
Alphanumeric id of the asset to which the image belongs.
Alphanumeric unique id identifying the image.
The original file name of the image.
A color constant as described above.
The desired width of the image.
The desired height of the image.

item.description:
You can choose the background color when using corner radius or the `pad` fit type.
It accepts RGB values such as `rgb:9090ff`. The default is white for JEPGs and transparent for PNGs and WEBPs.
